alert.note: Alert for Mountains Of San Benito County And Interior Monterey County Including Pinnacles National Park; Santa Lucia Mountains and Los Padres National Forest; Southern Salinas Valley, Arroyo Seco and Lake San Antonio (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Warning issued January 06 at 2:25PM PST until January 08 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FROST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 10 AM PST SUNDAY... ...FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT SUNDAY NIGHT TO 10 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Frost Advisory, temperatures as low as 30 will result in frost formation. For the Freeze Warning, sub- freezing temperatures as low as 28 expected. * WHERE...Southern Salinas Valley, Arroyo Seco, and Lake San Antonio, Santa Lucia Mountains and Los Padres National Forest and Mountains of San Benito and Interior Monterey County including Pinnacles National Park. * WHEN...For the Frost Advisory, from midnight tonight to 10 AM PST Sunday. For the Freeze Warning, from midnight Sunday night to 10 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Far interior locations of Monterey and San Benito counties will see a few spots reach the mid 20s Sunday night into Monday morning.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
